intro: Hormidium faustum, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with minimal water requirements. Hormidium faustum is also known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation.
